intro: Memecylon umbellatum, commonly known as the white-flowered memecylon, is a tropical plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its small, white, clustered flowers that bloom in umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Memecylon umbellatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
